intro: Triumfetta taruffii, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces small, pale yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Triumfetta taruffii is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some regions.
